# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here's the code to add a new column named 'ym' to your DataFrame df. It will extract the year and the month from the DateTime object, then concatenate them together as an integer in format yyyymm:
```julia-repl
# Define the function
function add_yearmonth(df)
    # Extract the year and month from dt column
    years = Dates.year.(df[:dt])
    months = Dates.month.(df[:dt])
    
    # Concatenate them together as an integer in format yyyymm
    df[!, :ym] .= 100 .* years .+ months
end

# Apply the function to add a new column to your DataFrame
add_yearmonth(df)
```
This code will create a new column `ym` in your DataFrame `df`. The year and month from each row of the `dt` column will be extracted and concatenated together as an integer in format yyyymm.

Note that this assumes your `dt` column contains DateTime objects, not strings or integers representing dates.
